title: (23500) Jódar - 9 Avenida de Andalucía

title: (23500) Jódar - 23 Calle Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente
title_short: (23500) Jódar - 23 Calle Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente
description:
In dead end, no disturb. Ideal for lunch. Even sleep Nice view and good step to go to Cazorla or Úbeda.
Also to visit the Sierra Mágina.
In the town there are municipal swimming pools, sports center,
 many supermarkets, restaurants and bars.
You can buy virgin olive oil, incredible! What flavor!!!
In the town you can visit the castle, church, laundry and museum. Ask at the town hall.

title: (23500) Jódar -

title: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
title_short: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
description: Parking in dirt but very passable with beautiful views of the mountains and olive groves. walk up about 200 m on the sidewalk and you arrive at a fountain, there you go through a park and you arrive at the main square. restaurant and shops. from there, continue up the small streets to the church and the remains of the castle. take good shoes because it climbs hard. good visit.

title: (23537) - JV-3222
description: Recreational area with ample parking (without restricting signs for the night), very quiet and clean. From the car park you have access to different routes: Torreón, Orio en Cuadros, Cueva del Agua, Río Cuadros, Adelfal and the Sanctuary of Pictures.

name: Área recreativa Cuadros
title: (23537) Área recreativa Cuadros

title: (23400) Úbeda - C 328
description: A stop along the way, a good place to stretch your legs. It is an unused train station.

name: Camping El Cantonet

title: (23538) Albanchez de Mágina - J-3105
description: Parking next to the Hutar recreation and leisure area, a hotel and a restaurant. With tables, sports area and fountains. Quite quiet both day and night (although on weekends and in summer with more movement). Good option as a base to visit both Albanchez and Sierra Mágina.

title: (23530) Jimena - 703 A-320
description: A small space to park and sleep. They fit about 4 small motorhomes. in case there is no one else a large motorhome alone too. the very quiet place, you can park there for the climb to the farm cave with cave paintings, but to see it before you have to talk to the town hall to be open. you have to follow the signs for the football field, and just in front (a little abandoned) is the site. Municipal swimming pools are just where you start climbing (only in summer). We spent the night on a very quiet Saturday in November

There are no signs of forbidden to stay overnight.

Cross the village of Albanchez with a little camper, painful on narrow streets. No service

Lovely planting all around. 10 minute slow walk to the historic quarter. An UNESCO world heritage site teamed with Bezea 10 km away. There is a cycle path between the two. Great food and free tapas are common!

title: (23196) Otiñar -

title: (23700) Linares - 17 Paseo Virgen de Linarejos
description: Very large underground parking. Beside the paseo and a laundromat. Apparently we can not sleep at night in Linares. But very convenient for a step.

title: (23700) Linares - P Virgen de Linarejos
description:
Paved esplanade with a water utility pole under repair.
It is marked as temporary parking for motorhomes.
Near the city center, on the promenade.
very nice city with atmosphere.

title: (23009) Jaén - 72 Calle Bedmar
description: Self-service laundry at Repsol gas station. They have an exclusive washing machine for pet clothes.

title: (23009) Jaén - 36 Paseo de España
description: Very wide avenue where as a rule there are no problems to park. We stayed one night and great. Next to a large park and 30 minutes from downtown walking. On working days from 7 in the morning there is some traffic

title: (23002) Jaén - 30-32 Calle Cerro de San Cristóbal
title_short: (23002) Jaén - 30-32 Calle Cerro de San Cristóbal
description: Quiet, parking area where you can spend the night, it is near the historic city of Jaen. We recommend visiting the cathedral.

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Nice parking lot in the woods at the start of the walk

title: (23006) Jaén - 9 Calle San Francisco Javier
description: Perfect and quiet to spend the night, the center is 15 minutes walk and the price is worth it because although it has no services it is guarded. It is ADIF parking.

title: (23639) Las Infantas - 15 Calle Francisco del Moral
title_short: (23639) Las Infantas - 15 Calle Francisco del Moral
description: Reasonable area to stay overnight enroute to Madrid from southern Spain.

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Beautiful parking space in the Hoyo de los Pinos recreational area in the Sierra del Pozo. Cazorla natural park. Very close to the bowling alley ravine where canyoning is practiced and the bowling alley reservoir. With picnic area, water, barbecues, containers, games area and restaurant

name: Camping la Bolera
title: () Camping la Bolera
description: Camping sierra cazorla 2. Beautiful cool in summer and cold in winter with beautiful hiking trails place. Near the dam of the bowling alley. Many good restaurants nearby.

title: (23009) Jaén - 2 Calle Antonio Collado Almazan
description: Quiet place to park and spend the night, little traffic, little unevenness. There is a large boulevard 300 meters along which to walk, a bus stop that brings you to the center, a laundry 500 meters away.

title: (23470) La Iruela - 28 Avenida del Guadalquivir
description: Beautiful place to spend the day and admire the course of the river, it is the starting point of some hiking trails, the place is very quiet and you can see animals that come down to drink, there is a park nearby with tables of picnic and the village is next door wonderful place please keep it clean. Overnight stay is prohibited in the entire town.

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Beautiful place on the shores of the Bolera reservoir surrounded by nature. Very quiet place to spend the day and night, we were alone. In the morning we were visited by two small fallow deer. Access track a bit complicated because it is rocky and has a steep slope in some sections.

title: (23485) Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Small car park next to a hermitage, a good place to visit the Enchanted Higueras Forest from here. It does not have any type of service, not even containers. More a place to go on the go than anything else.

title: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
title_short: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
description:
Linarejos recreational area. It has picnic tables, bathrooms (when we were there they were closed) and what appears to be a beach bar (also closed). Quiet area, surrounded by nature and with little telephone signal (3G).
Overnight stays are not allowed, there are signs prohibiting overnight stays and camping.

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: Paid motorhome parking with gray and black emptying service and water filling, animals accepted, free Wi-Fi, etc. 20€/24h

title: (18815) La Ermita - A-326
description: Large car park without prohibition. Very quiet even though the road is close. Very little traffic. Nice view of the lake and part of the dam. Trash on site.

title: (23002) Jaén - 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González
title_short: (23002) Jaén - 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González
description: Slightly sloping parking, ample parking. Quiet at night, in summer more crowded. 20 minutes walk to the city center. Nice views.

address.street: 2 Calle Dean de la Fuente González

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking next to the road that connects Pozoalcon and Huescar, over the Bolera reservoir Ideal place for hiking. A 5 min walk away is the restaurant of the recreational area of Bolera and Camping, which also has a restaurant.

title: (23150) El Parrizoso -
description: Another excellent place to spend the day/night and enjoy the calm of the area. Beautiful hiking trails and very good tracks and lanes to practice MTB. They are mobile data coverage.

title: (23004) Jaén - 30 Carretera al Parador
description: Very quiet place, hardly any traffic, shade and good views of Jaén, on the weekend I imagine from the remains of MC that I see, it must be more crowded

title: (23196) Jaén - Unnamed Road
description: Surrounded by a small road where nobody passes, in the middle of the forest and in peace. We stayed here the night.

title: (18567) Domingo Pérez - Cam. Casa Nueva
description: Small shady spot (in the middle of the day) near a spring, with a bench for a picnic. Very quiet place below a hamlet. Please keep it clean: there is even a trash can, so there is no excuse for leaving your small papers and other waste on the floor!

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking in the bowling alley restroom area. Very quiet place with picnic tables, water, garbage and restaurant

title: (23300) Sierra - Unnamed Road
description:
At 890 meters above sea level, in the middle of the Sierra, we have 2 hectares, surrounded by nature. We want to share this place with campers. There are several waterfalls in the area. Vultures fly around and deer regularly roam there.

 Possibility of Clean Water and Emptying of the WC (Vinegar preferably). Accepted animals. children too.

 The maximum stay is 1 week or consult.

 Only for 4x4 motorhomes or small motorhomes

title: (23150) El Parrizoso -
description: A siding on the runway. Good views and quiet. With data coverage. It doesn't have more, but for lonely souls it's good. Take care of the access: it has a somewhat pronounced ramp and long vehicles can rub against the back!!

title: (23005) Jaén - Calle Hospital de San Lazaro
title_short: (23005) Jaén - Calle Hospital de San Lazaro
description: Parking with some unevenness

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: After about 1km on sometimes stony and steep dirt road (4x4 or high van necessary) arrived in a clearing in the middle of wild animals (we saw fallow deer, wild boar, a doe and a deer which bellowed for a good part of the night)

title: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: () Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Probably one of the most beautiful places to spend a night !!! Calm, seclusion, Nature in its raw state. Accessible by gravel path of about 12 km from the village of Villanueva de Las Torres. Vehicle therefore suitable (4x4, crossover or small vehicle with good traction on hills !!! Breathtaking view !!!

title: (23006) Jaén - s/n Calle Fuente del Serbo
title_short: (23006) Jaén - s/n Calle Fuente del Serbo
description: Open parking, without a barrier, asphalt, flat, from a Lidl supermarket, easy access for large ACs. Opposite is a large playground and a Burger King. You can take a walk to the center and visit the city. There are no services.

title: (23004) Jaén - 2 Explanada Cañoquebrado
description: Picnic area with cement tables and chairs. Easy parking

title: (23460) Peal de Becerro -
description: Point of view Quesada. Surrounded by nature. Tranquility and beautiful view.

title: (23194) Jaén - 51 Diseminado Ctra Valdepeñas
description: Picnic area next to the road, quiet although with the noise of some cars, frequented by people walking. Perfect for visiting Jaén, with a bike path to the city, you can go for a walk although without lighting. Nearby climbing routes.

title: (23004) Jaén - 1 Carretera al Neveral
description: Hospital parking near the castle, 3.5 km from the cathedral. Very calm.

title: (23002) Jaén -
description: Rest area if you are passing through, quiet place,

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: Near the hot spring.

title: (23300) Sierra -
description: Secluded spot outside Mogón. Last 5km is along a gravel road in good condition and passable with all vehicles. Use the road that follows the river out the north-east of Mogón that passes the “Huerta Rubiales”. Other routes are very rough otherwise. Waterfalls are 30-60mins hike further along the trail. Occasional phone signal coverage but not to be relied on.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres - GR-6101
description: In the spa car park, ideal for visiting the petroglyphs, the dolmens, the Toril aqueduct, the megalithic interpretation center of Gorafe.

title: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
title_short: (18890) Villanueva de las Torres - Camino de los Campos Mones
description: Views in the nowhere close to Gorafe, where there are over 200 dolmens. Very quiet and lonely. Access for large vehicles not suitable. 4 x 4 with access from Gorafe/Guadix at least in bad weather advantage, Villanueva de las Torres sis imperative (particularly after rain dangerous). The route is scenic eunderschön!  No facilities.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Bivouac at the Los Coloraos viewpoint in the Gorafe desert. Spectacular view and only night in the world

title: (23005) Jaén - 1 Diseminado Ctra Cordoba
description: Natural area. Difficult access for Ac. Climbing area "4 peaks"

title: (23300) Sierra - 35 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Picnic area in the Aguascebas reservoir in the middle of the natural park, equipped with picnic areas, garbage cans and a children's area. Beautiful views of the reservoir. You can park 1 or 2 AC or 2 camper ... the terrain is uneven although some areas are flat. Overnight is not allowed.

title: (18539) Villanueva de las Torres -
description: Small flat place next to a path 20m from the GR6100. We spent a beautiful night in a beautiful and peaceful environment

title: (23620) Mengíbar - 12 Carretera Villargordo
description: Ample parking with restaurant and gas station nearby

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description: Next to a quiet road, flat land that can accommodate 2 or 3 vehicles. Magnificent view. No service.

title: (23140) Noalejo - 66 Avenida de la Constitucion
description: Free public parking. Very quiet and safe. Level concrete floor.

title: (18860) Olivar -
description: Beautiful place with a great view. Easily accessible for 4x4 with ground clearance (the driveway was dusty and dry for me - it can be a bit more difficult to reach when wet) - about 20 meters after the turning loop, relatively flat and good to stand for one night. Hardly any traffic and when it gets dark it is completely lonely. No service, but LTE reception. Attention, the terrain is partly very steep - danger of falling when walking at night, but a beautiful starry sky.

title: (18890) Gorafe - GR-6100
description:
A level gravel bay, similar to the others along this road. This one is sheltered by rock on 3 sides. Perfect for when the wind is a bit too strong to be out in the open.
No paths or attractions, just a secluded quiet spot for the night.

title: (23150) El Parrizoso -
description: Spectacular car park, next to a rural road with very little traffic. Beautiful views and hiking trails in the surroundings. Very quiet to spend a time of recollection. Despite its isolation, it has mobile coverage. Access is by a paved road, but relatively narrow.

title: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
title_short: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
description: Parking dam, great view, very quiet !!

title: (18890) Gorafe -
description: Please note that this site is reserved for aesthetes and perfectionists! Surely my most beautiful spot of the year. Spot set back from the main track which is otherwise very uncrowded. Go straight on the motorable track that starts from the megalite car park before Gorafe, in the direction of los Coloraos for 9km, small branch on the right, it's flat, no need for wedges.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: In the middle of nowhere in the middle of nowhere, absolute tranquility and silence, accessible with a motorhome with enhanced traction or 4x4, otherwise do not venture on the track, it is sometimes in poor condition, with steep slopes

title: (18568) Píñar - 52 Calle Real
description: Parking lot next to the main street of the city. Easy access, unpaved ground, space for 3 vehicles. Quiet area with no services ideal for visiting the village and the cave of the windows

title: (23160) Los Villares - 5 Calle García Lorca
description: Asphalted parking in a square on the top of the city, nearby there is an olive bar with terrace and good fish

title: (23140) Noalejo - C. de Todos los Santos
title_short: (23140) Noalejo - C. de Todos los Santos
description: Cemetery car park. quiet place because at the end of the road. view of the mountains. wide squares. however the road leading to it is a bit narrow

title: (18565) Campotéjar - E-902
description: Water tap at rear of service station

title: (23160) Los Villares - 6 Calle Egido
description: Parking area inclined, few seats, not very comfortable

title: (23220) Vilches - 1 Calle Cuesta de la Piscina
title_short: (23220) Vilches - 1 Calle Cuesta de la Piscina
description: Esplanade of the fair (La Sartén), next to Parque el Huevo, good access on foot to the promenade with the viewpoint, the castle of the Virgin and caves. You can cover / eat very well in the area, next to it there is a bar called La Sarten That is covered / eats marvelous. Municipal swimming pool next to the parking lot (only open in summer with entrance fee). And many places to visit.

title: (23478) - 112 Diseminado Extrarradio
description: Parking without overnight problems. Not particularly beautiful and close to the road, but with other virtues: a restaurant next door (where game meat is eaten quite well and a menu of 13 euros more than acceptable), there are usually no people (even on weekends). weekdays or bridges, when everything is usually full until it is almost impossible to find parking in towns or recreational areas) with a garbage can and good 4g coverage; In addition, to spend the night is great, because from 23 to 8 it is very quiet. Option to consider in high season.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Camino de Negretín
description: A nice little corner for a midday meal, I'm there, and maybe for one night but not tested. No service.

title: (18890) Gorafe - Unnamed Road
description: Desert of Gorafe, along the track. Stunning and calm view. Small promontory that allows to be sheltered from the morning sun. Access in T5.

title: (23338) Iznatoraf - 22 Calle Carretera
description: Shared parking. parking located at the top of the city easy to find. steep access but no problem for a 7 m cc. pretty village. small grocery store nearby with bread.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Vial Camino

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Balcón del Negratín
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - Balcón del Negratín
description: Point of view of the Negratin Reservoir. Location surrounded by nature for all types of vehicles. BBQ area and sink. Playground for children although very badly used. Beautiful views and road to the left of the point of view that goes down to the reservoir but the return has a significant rise. It is possible to sleep. Something tilting but you can search for flat areas. Toilet currently closed.

title: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
title_short: (18813) Cuevas del Campo - 1 Calle Presa del Negratin
description: Embalse del Negratin Superb view of the dam bar in season picnic table calm at night length of the motorhome maximum 7'50 meters

title: (18540) Huélago - GR-4102
description: Good place to stay outside the village of Huélago. Near the road, but little traffic, that is barely audible. Recreation area under pine trees.

title: (18890) Gorafe -

title: (18540) Huélago - A-401
description: Quiet place to sleep, rest, there is a very cozy bar open at 7.30, close, depends on the clientele, eats very well, also luxury breakfast,

title: (23710) Bailén - 31 Calle Paquita Torres
description: Quiet place to park and sleep. near the center

title: (18890) Gorafe - 1 Calle Alhambra

title_short: (18890) Gorafe - n4 Plaza de la Constitución
